title: Abyss

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Abyss is an area of Abyssal Space that contains rifts created by the Zamorak Magical Institute with which they directly access the runic altars without the need for a talisman, with the exception of the Astral and Wrath Altar. Accessing this area of the Abyss requires completion of the miniquest Enter the Abyss. In appearance, it seems to be oddly organic, with eyes, boils, and strange-looking tendrils.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Abyss
This article is about the Abyss location. For other uses, see Abyss (disambiguation).
 This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
Abyss
Released13 June 2005 (Update)
MembersYes
LocationAbyssal Space
InhabitantsAbyssal monsters
TeleportsMage of Zamorak
Map

The Abyss is an area of Abyssal Space that contains rifts created by the Zamorak Magical Institute with which they directly access the runic altars without the need for a talisman, with the exception of the Astral and Wrath Altar. Accessing this area of the Abyss requires completion of the miniquest Enter the Abyss. In appearance, it seems to be oddly organic, with eyes, boils, and strange-looking tendrils.

The location of the Mage of Zamorak

The Abyss consists of two rings: a dangerous outer ring in a multicombat area and a safe inner ring with rifts leading to the runic altars. Aside from the aggressive abyssal creatures inhabiting it, players who enter the Abyss will have their prayer points drained to 0 and be immediately given a skull, although an abyssal bracelet can be worn to prevent the player from getting automatically skulled.

Fastest routes to the Abyss.

Perhaps the most dangerous aspect of accessing the Abyss is the fact that players have to travel through part of the low-level Wilderness to reach the Mage of Zamorak, who is the only NPC that teleports the player to this part of the Abyss. This causes a risk of being attacked by the occasional player killer, so some degree of caution is required when reaching the mage.

Contents

  • 1 Inside the Abyss
    • 1.1 Outer ring
    • 1.2 Inner ring
  • 2 Changes

Inside the Abyss[edit | edit source]

The interior of the Abyss is roughly circular, with an 'inner' and 'outer' ring. After the player is teleported into the outer ring, they will have to find a way through to the inner ring where the rifts leading to the runic altars are located.

Outer ring[edit | edit source]

The outer ring contains a large number of Abyssal monsters:

  • Abyssal walker (melee, combat level: 81)
  • Abyssal guardian (melee + magic, combat level: 59)
  • Abyssal leech (melee, combat level: 41)

These monsters can hit over 12 (with the exception of the leeches, which hit a maximum of 2), although they often miss if the player has a decent Defence level (65+) and wears adequate armour such as dragonhide. However, the abyssal monsters should still not be underestimated as, due to their large numbers, a player in the Abyss may take several hits per second. Players take no damage from the monsters while attempting to pass through to the inner ring. Minimising the time between attempts thus increases a player's chances of survival.

Players access the inner ring by attempting one of five skill-based obstacles:

  • Chopping away tendrils using an axe.
  • Mining through rock using a pickaxe.
  • Distracting eyes (Thieving skill needed, but no object needed).
  • Squeezing through gaps
  • Burning away boils using a tinderbox.

These obstacles have randomly generated locations upon a player's arrival in the Abyss and can be in different locations for different players at the same time. The chances of passing the obstacle increase with the player's level in the corresponding skill. Each attempt has a level+1 percent chance of success, meaning that the player reaches a 100% success rate at level 99. Passing an obstacle grants 25 experience in the corresponding skill.

Upon entering the Abyss, the player always appears near the mining obstacle or the agility obstacle. With a high Mining or Agility level, this can be used to one's advantage to train more efficiently. An alternative to the agility obstacle is to proceed past the agility obstacle and pass via the thieving obstacle. Yet another alternative to the mining obstacle is to proceed past the mining obstacle and pass via the woodcutting obstacle.

At the southern central area of this outer ring lies a small opening, which provides one-way passage to the Abyssal Nexus, a part of the Abyss occupied by Abyssal Sires.

Inner ring[edit | edit source]

The inner ring of the Abyss.

There are no monsters in the inner ring of the Abyss. There are rifts leading to every runic altar (except the Astral and Wrath Altars) there, which makes the Abyss useful for crafting a lot of different types of runes very quickly. Talismans or tiaras are not needed to access the altars via the rifts. The following restrictions still apply:

  • The cosmic rift can only be entered when the quest Lost City has been completed.
  • The law rift can only be entered when the quest Troll Stronghold has been completed. In addition, entering it has the same restrictions as entering Entrana, so players cannot bring prohibited equipment.
  • The death rift can only be entered when the quest Mourning's End Part II has been completed.
  • The blood rift can only be entered when the quest Sins of the Father has been completed.
    • The blood rift can also access Kourend's Blood Altar by using a dark essence block or fragments on the rift after having crafting blood runes on it.
  • The soul rift can only be accessed by using a dark essence block or fragments on the rift after having crafting soul runes at Kourend's Soul Altar.

There is a Z.M.I. initiate standing at the centre of the inner ring (yellow spot on the minimap), maintaining the Abyssal Rift. He will repair player's essence pouches for free.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
30 March 2022
(update)

Fixed a visual bug that appeared while wearing the abyssal bracelet and teleporting to the Abyss.

22 March 2022
(update)

The blood rift can now be used to teleport to the true blood altar and the Kourend's blood altar.

7 January 2016
(update)

The blood and soul rifts are now usable.

1 October 2015
(update)

Passage to the Abyssal Nexus added.

26 June 2014
(update | poll)

Click zone increase for abyssal rifts.

The '''Abyss''' is an area of [[Abyssal Space]] that contains rifts created by the [[Zamorak Magical Institute]] with which they directly access the [[runic altars]] without the need for a [[talisman]], with the exception of the [[Astral Altar|Astral]] and [[Wrath Altar]]. Accessing this area of the Abyss requires completion of the [[miniquest]] [[Enter the Abyss]]. In appearance, it seems to be oddly organic, with eyes, boils, and strange-looking tendrils.
{{Map|name=Mage of Zamorak|x=3104|y=3560|r=4|mtype=square|caption=The location of the Mage of Zamorak|align=left|width=250|height=250}}
The Abyss consists of two rings: a dangerous outer ring in a [[multicombat area]] and a safe inner ring with rifts leading to the runic altars. Aside from the aggressive [[abyssal creatures]] inhabiting it, players who enter the Abyss will have their [[prayer points]] drained to 0 and be immediately given a [[skull (status)|skull]], although an [[abyssal bracelet]] can be worn to prevent the player from getting automatically skulled. 

[[File:Abyss Routes.png|right|thumb|175px|Fastest routes to the Abyss.]]

Perhaps the most dangerous aspect of accessing the Abyss is the fact that players have to travel through part of the low-level [[Wilderness]] to reach the [[Mage of Zamorak]], who is the only NPC that teleports the player to this part of the Abyss. This causes a risk of being attacked by the occasional [[player killer]], so some degree of caution is required when reaching the mage.

==Inside the Abyss==
The interior of the Abyss is roughly circular, with an 'inner' and 'outer' ring. After the player is teleported into the outer ring, they will have to find a way through to the inner ring where the rifts leading to the runic altars are located.

===Outer ring===
The outer ring contains a large number of [[Abyssal monster]]s:
* [[Abyssal walker]] (melee, [[combat level]]: 81)
* [[Abyssal guardian]] (melee + magic, combat level: 59)
* [[Abyssal leech]] (melee, combat level: 41)
These monsters can hit over 12 (with the exception of the leeches, which hit a maximum of 2), although they often miss if the player has a decent [[Defence]] level (65+) and wears adequate [[armour]] such as [[dragonhide]]. However, the abyssal monsters should still not be underestimated as, due to their large numbers, a player in the Abyss may take several hits per second. Players take no damage from the monsters while attempting to pass through to the inner ring. Minimising the time between attempts thus increases a player's chances of survival.

Players access the inner ring by attempting one of five skill-based obstacles:
* [[Woodcutting|Chopping]] away tendrils using an [[axe]].
* [[Mining]] through rock using a [[pickaxe]].
* [[Thieving|Distracting]] eyes ([[Thieving]] skill needed, but no object needed).
* [[Agility|Squeezing]] through gaps 
* [[Firemaking|Burning]] away boils using a [[tinderbox]].

These obstacles have randomly generated locations upon a player's arrival in the Abyss and can be in different locations for different players at the same time. The chances of passing the obstacle increase with the player's level in the corresponding skill. Each attempt has a level+1 percent chance of success, meaning that the player reaches a 100% success rate at level 99. Passing an obstacle grants 25 [[experience]] in the corresponding skill.

Upon entering the Abyss, the player always appears near the mining obstacle or the agility obstacle. With a high Mining or Agility level, this can be used to one's advantage to train more efficiently. An alternative to the agility obstacle is to proceed past the agility obstacle and pass via the thieving obstacle. Yet another alternative to the mining obstacle is to proceed past the mining obstacle and pass via the [[woodcutting]] obstacle.

At the southern central area of this outer ring lies a small opening, which provides one-way passage to the [[Abyssal Nexus]], a part of the Abyss occupied by [[Abyssal Sire]]s.

===Inner ring===
[[File:Inner ring of the Abyss.png|right|thumb|175px|The inner ring of the Abyss.]]
There are no monsters in the inner ring of the Abyss. There are rifts leading to every [[runic altar]] (except the [[Astral Altar|Astral]] and [[Wrath Altar]]s) there, which makes the Abyss useful for crafting a lot of different types of runes very quickly. [[Talismans]] or [[tiara]]s are '''not''' needed to access the altars via the rifts. The following restrictions still apply:
* The [[cosmic rift]] can only be entered when the quest [[Lost City]] has been completed.
* The [[law rift]] can only be entered when the quest [[Troll Stronghold]] has been completed. In addition, entering it has the same restrictions as entering [[Entrana]], so players cannot bring [[Entrana#Prohibited equipment|prohibited equipment]].
* The [[death rift]] can only be entered when the quest [[Mourning's End Part II]] has been completed.
* The [[blood rift]] can only be entered when the quest [[Sins of the Father]] has been completed. 
** The blood rift can also access [[Kourend]]'s [[Blood Altar (Kourend)|Blood Altar]] by using a [[dark essence block]] or [[Dark essence fragments|fragments]] on the rift after having crafting blood runes on it.
* The [[soul rift]] can only be accessed by using a dark essence block or fragments on the rift after having crafting soul runes at Kourend's [[Soul Altar]].

There is a [[Dark Mage (Abyss)|Z.M.I. initiate]] standing at the centre of the inner ring (yellow spot on the minimap), maintaining the [[Abyssal Rift]]. He will repair player's [[essence pouch]]es for free.
